Poverty, income and wealth inequality
Malaysia's sustained rapid real GDP growth of 6.4% per annum from 1970 to 2015 reduced the
incidence of absolute poverty from 49.3% to 0.6% (World Bank, World Development Indicators).
Some challenges remain, with higher rates of absolute poverty in rural areas (1.6%), for children under
15 (1.7%) and for particular ethnic groups (Orang Asli 34%; Bumiputera Sabah 20.2% and Bumiputera
Sarawak 7.3%)
